intro: Eremogone subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf eremogone, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its small, spiny leaves are adapted to reduce water loss and protect against herbivory. Eremogone subulata is often found in open landscapes, contributing to the ecological stability of its habitat.
